inn1.comm: and he oversteps first ball, it was a length ball on target, but a free hit coming up
gives him a short free hit, Obanda had set himself up for a huge swing, but missed it completely, they sneak a leg bye as the ball rolls away in to the on side
fuller on the pads, he solidly plays it out to midwicket
good line from Southee, around off stump, Waters goes back and defends it towards cover
loud shout for leg before, nippy length delivery that struck him on the pads as he flicked across the line, but the umpire thought that was going down leg, i think he thought rightly too
tucks him up for room nicely, bang on middle stump on a length, Waters plays it back to Southee
touch fuller, still no room at all to work with, dug out towards mid on, good over from Southee
flat and on leg stump, he works it away to short midwicket
fuller, much fuller, he is beaten as he looks to flick it through midwicket, takes it on the pads
off target goes Nathan, turning one way down leg
works a fuller one away to mid on and hustles the single
played back to the bowler, that round the stumps angle gives no room to the batsman
and another one, this one was almost yorker length, and he dug it out to mid on
goes wider outside off stump, and he drives it without power to extra cover
tucked away off the pads backward of square leg
this is pretty neat stuff from the bowler, full length on middle stump, he is circumspect in his defence back down the track
gets some width outside off and opens the bat face to take a single down to third man
another straight delivery, there is no seam, no swing, but there is no width either, and he pushes it towards mid on
shortens the length around off stump, he taps it to cover and thinks of a single but the fielder is quick to get to the ball
looks to swing him straight down the ground but is hit on the pads off the inside edge
tossed up a shade and defended down the track
loops in the air off the pads, and slip goes across to take it and hazards an appeal, just in case
another tight delivery pushed down the pitch
gets forward and pushes to extra cover
goes across and works a fuller one wide of mid on
quicker one on leg stump, hastily played out to midwicket, New Zealand have given nothing away in the initial few overs
dug in short of a good length, he gets in to some sort of a tangle as he decides to work it square but is hit on the thigh pad
for the first time, Southee offers a lot of width outside off stump, but he fails to capitalise, a hint of away shape, just a hint, bit of bounce too, the attempted cut remains only an attempt
another one goes past the edge of the bat, this one was fuller, closer to off, and whats more, it straightened to whizz past the forward poke
confident looking drive from Waters, got to the pitch of a wide and full ball outside off, but his shot went straight to point
this time he stays back to a shorter one, and guides it just behind point, enough for a quick run
another single, that's what Kenya seem to be interested in right now, this time to the left of midwicket off a fuller ball
flicked wide of mid on with a flourish for a single
takes a step forward, does not help much, in he end he plays out this one towards the bowler
another one fired in on the stumps, he defends it back to Nathan
now he shortens the length, and he goes back to hit it past midwicket
fired in on leg stump, too much for the batsman who pushes it back to the bowler
gets forward and gets an inside edge towards square leg, the run rate now touches two
Kenya are not attempting anything but survival right now, another fullish ball on the stumps is dug out down the track, Southee leaps and fields
alright there is an attempt to break free, but he was late on the pull to the short ball, and hit it towards mid on
this one nips in with the angle from over the stumps, stays a bit low, he had no clue about it, and was rapped on the pads, the ball rolled away wide of slip
takes another one on the pads, this time pretty high, leg sidish from Southee but he could do nothing about it
this one is dug in, and takes off, just past the batsman's head who attempts a weak pull, and goes nowhere with it

finally Southee gets some reward for some tight bowling, this one was pitched on a length, and went on with the angle to hit Obanda on the pads, New Zealand went up, so too did umpire Erasmus' finger, looked to be heading towards leg stump, but replays show it bouncing just over the top of the stumps, Kenya haven't gone for the review
driven towards long on for a single
skips down the track and pushes a flighted one to mid off
stays back to a skidding flat delivery and works it away square on the leg side
we have some intent from a Kenya batsman, and we have a boundary, the first one of the innings, came down the track, and lofted him over mid off, clean hit
comes down the track again, but this time Nathan does not not give it much air, and he defends it
furiously sweeps a full delivery, and gets it past short fine leg, second boundary of the over, of the innings too
taps a back of a length one in front of cover, and looks towards Obuya, who is already half way down the pitch, and the single is easily taken
gets a bouncer just outside off stump, and calmly lets it go past him
caught on the back foot, just a bit of inward movement off the seam, cramped him up totally, they take a tight single as the ball rolls away off the inside edge
the good old Chinese cut, too close for the conventional form of the shot, Waters goes for it anyways, and gets a healthy inside edge that beats the keeper
takes a half step forward to a fullish ball and pushes it out to point
clipped away emphatically off the pads, but there is midwicket, and he moves across to field
bowls a short delivery in to his body first up, he swivels, and is a bit late on the pull, but gets it past square leg
short of a good length, again in to the body, he rides the bounce, and tucks it to short fine leg, if there was a direct hit at the non-striker's, he was gone
continues with the back of a length stuff, Obuya was expecting it, walked across and worked it away behind square leg
goes very full now, on the stumps too, he was caught on the back foot just for an instant, and adjusted to squeeze it out to mid on
nicely behind the line of a length delivery around off stump, and defends it to cover
too straight from Hamish, flicked past the square leg umpire for a single
tossed up on middle and leg, driven weakly to mid on
skiddy stuff from Dan, he pushed forward and it went straight on to hit him on the pads
gets bat to ball this time and defends one to cover
caught in two minds, had no clue about this one, just managed to somehow keep it out, off an inside edge on to pad
driven to long off for a single
drops it a touch short, and he cuts it in a flash past backward point
gets on top of a shortish ball outside off stump, and cuts it wide of backward point for a single
he is remaining in the crease for a trifle too long, and that's why when he belatedly gets forward there is no power on the drive, this one rolls away to backward point
lets a length ball come on to him outside off and steers it to third man
absolutely no clue about a nasty short one that got big and struck him on the gloves as he looked to work it square, the ball rolled away to point
confidently forward this time to a length ball and drives it to mid off for a single, an overthrow gives them another

full and angled in on the stumps, Waters is late on it and plays around it to be struck on the pads, the umpire thinks long before raising the finger, the batsmen get together, and decide not to review it, Waters walks back after a stuttering innings, replays show that would have taken out leg
flat and quick, cut away to backward point
pushed forward to defend down the track
giving him no room, another one on the stumps, cannot do anything with it
lovely variation from Dan, the tossed up one slower through the air, some turn too, he pushed forward in defence
another one pushed out towards cover
can't get Dan away, plays out another one to backward point
punched away off the back foot past point and wide of third man, Tikolo is away

cleaned him up, what a delivery, full and steaming in on the stumps, Tikolo plays all over it, and it crashes in to the base of middle, and takes out off stump too for good measure, Kenya have lost their most experienced player
looks for the magic full delivery again, but sprays it down the leg side
Ouma plays with a high backlift, like many West Indies batsmen, and pushes out a length ball towards point

gets one to land on a length and go on to strike him on the pads as he shuffles across too much, the umpire thought the ball was also doing too much, and they some runs as the ball goes wide of fine leg

they continue to fall, another fullish delivery, this one stayed low, and rapped him on the pads, Bennett asked the question and got an affirmative answer from the umpire, Kenya try to delay the inevitable with a decision review, but that is dead, that is hitting middle, he just played outside the line, and now has to walk back, Kenya in tatters
wide outside off stump, very short too, and left alone
gets forward to the pitch of a full delivery and drives to extra cover
very full from Dan, he squeezes it out to mid off, and they take the tight single, even as the throw is wide of the keeper
rolls away off the pads on to the leg side
tossed up around off stump, and pushed back to Dan
more flight from the bowler, the batsman dead bats it down the pitch
goes for the sweep to a full delivery, and gets an edge that goes between his legs and the stumps, and past short fine leg, how is that for placement?
Bennett is searching for this deadly full deliveries, but goes down the pads this time, and is helped away to fine leg
gets it off the toe end of the bat as he looks to leave one in the channel outside off stump, slip tidies up

Bennett is on fire, and Kenya are wilting under the heat, it was very full and quick, Ouma was late on the attempted flick, and the bat was late in coming in front of pad, up went the finger, but hello, replays show he was struck comfortably outside the line of off stump, but Kenya decided not to review it, well if they reviewed the plumb leg before of Obuya, they could have done this one too, but alas, they don't, and are five down one short of 50
lovely stuff from Bennett, he has consistently been looking to hit the stumps, or the pads, with full deliveries angled in to the batsman, this time he gets an inside edge on to pad
more full length stuff, clipped away without any conviction towards midwicket
decides to have a swing at this one close to off stump from the crease, it somehow goes between the bat and the stump, on the bounce to the keeper
defended down the track off the back foot
looks to break free with a slog sweep, but is nowhere near the line of the ball, takes it on the body
dead bats a tossed up ball, and gets an inside edge close to the keeper on the leg side, Brendon runs quickly and hits the stumps, but the batsman was just in
played out to cover off the front foot
bobs up in the air off the inside edge as he pushes half forward, but there is no one at short leg, queer
had no clue about this delivery, took two steps down the track, stopped totally, and then defended it off an inside edge
Bennett with the full one on the pads, and is flicked away to deep square leg
pacy delivery just outside of stump, left well alone
this one seemed to stop on him, it is a bit two paced, this wicket, he was forward in defence and the ball lobbed up in the air but again no one at short leg
swings at a full delivery from the crease, and gets an inside edge that rolls away towards point, he is getting it to shape in a bit
late on the front foot drive, gets an inside edge that rolls away towards midwicket
goes off target with a high full toss, and it is tucked away down to fine leg
shot! it was tossed up on off stump, and he went for the slog sweep, getting it along the ground wide of deep square leg for a welcome boundary
now he plays the cute paddle, getting into position even as the ball was delivered, and taking it off middle stump, and just past the keeper
Kamande is more circumspect, off the pads in to the leg side
slow turner outside off stump, punched away down the ground to long off
tossed up slowly through the air, he gets forward and defends
super bowling from Vettori, this one is flighted just a shade lesser, and hurries on after pitching, he gets bat to ball just in time
gets some extra bounce with that tall frame of his from a length, and the batsman defends it towards cover off the back foot
much fuller on middle and leg, hurriedly played out towards mid on
cut away off the back foot in front of cover, without much power, and no timing
played out to point off the back foot, good start from Oram so far

gets his man in his first over, he pitched it a shade fuller outside off, Kamande looked to run it down to third man, but the extra bounce that Oram normally gets did him in, and the thick edge flew to the right of Baz who held on comfortably, more worries for Kenya
plays out a fuller one to short midwicket
solidly forward in defence to a flighted delivery
comes down the track, abandons all aggressive intentions and plays a defensive push in the end
cut away to sweeper cover off the back foot
waits on the back foot for it to turn from off stump, and plays it out to point
flicked airily, very airily, but midwicket is eerily vacant, and he is away with a couple
much quicker and flatter, played out down the track
steered down to third man
looks to play something more than a defensive shot to a length delivery, but there was room only to do that, and so he does that, block it down the track, that is

another one stops on the batsman, there have been a few of those, but the problem for Odoyo was, it also produced the Oram extra bounce, Odoyo was taken by surprise and ungainly fended it in the air for Jesse to take the dolliest of dollies at point, dear me, Kenya have gone nowhere in this innings
defended off the back foot towards extra cover
fuller this time, he cannot beat extra cover with a firm push
what a delivery, beats everyone from a very full length, batsman, who flails at it, stumps that stand still, and keeper who makes a vain effort to stop the byes
tucks him up with a back of a length ball, he defends it off the back foot
fuller delivery on the pads, flicked away to fine leg
Southee gets ambitious with the leg before appeal, the batsman was struck high on the pads, but it was slipping down leg
goes for an extravagant drive to a full delivery, but gets an inside edge on to pad and the ball rolls away towards point, there have been so many of them today, inside edges, and wickets too
and another one goes, nothing shot really, swinging wildly to a full delivery that was of the you-miss-I-hit types, well Odhiambo missed, and the ball uprooted off stump, ho hum

two in two for Tim, pinpoint yorker on the stumps, and before the bat could come down, the ball had crashed on to boot, not much to decide for the umpire, Southee is on a hat trick with one wicket to go
pitched up close to the batsman, who gets forward and drives in the air, but wide of extra cover
solidly behind the line of this length delivery around off stump
full toss outside off stump, but he cannot beat Nathan at mid off with the drive
swinging in a touch and landing almost on a yorker length close to off stump, dug out to point

oops, there will be no hat trick for Southee, another one stopped on the batsman, he was already well forward and pushing hard at it, and the ball flew to one of the two men at short midwicket, it's all over for Kenya, nice gesture from the big man Oram, grins sheepishly and gestures apologetically in the direction of Southee, who has an even broader smile on his face

inn2.comm: short of a length and seaming away from off stump, he pushes it to the right of cover, who makes a diving stop
played out towards point off the back foot
punched off the back foot to that man at short extra cover
well left outside the off stump
dismissed through midwicket, Guptill plays those pulls so well, gets in to position quickly, picks up the length early, and crashes it into the gap
now he goes hard at one that is far outside off stump, and slashes it down to a squarish third man
gets one short of a good length, and sends it screaming through extra cover, waited for the ball to arrive and picked the gap neatly
Kenya don;t want to wait in the Chennai heat for long, short and wide, he gets on top of it and sends it in to  orbit over a vainly leaping point
better delivery, a touch fuller, closer to off stump, left alone
beaten on the pull, it was too close to him for the shot, and he was beaten as he swivelled on a leg
lets one go outside the off stump
takes a step out and defends this length delivery out to point
defended off the back foot towards covers

oops, Baz went for the ambitious pull, but it seemed to stop on him as he went through with the shot, the ball was up in the air for ages, but no one could get to it as it fell between midwicket and square leg
good full length delivery on the stumps, tickled away behind square leg
played out in front of point off the back foot

looks to go over square leg with the heave, but is struck on the pads, Odoyo thinks he is on to something, the umpire thinks he isn't, going down leg that one, Kenya go for the review anyway, and find that the umpire was right
lovely shot, got one full on middle, and lifted it straight back over the umpire, one bounce in to the boundary, also holds the pose for effect
he keeps going for these ambitious pulls, this one just manages to clear midwicket, he is not timing them cleanly, getting far forward with the initial movement
pushed out firmly to extra cover off the front foot, this one thudded in to the bat from a length
stays on the back foot, and punches a length ball to mid on, much like Sehwag was doing yesterday
he wants to go back quickly, got one in the slot, and tonked it over mid off, it was hit so well it carried all the way over the ropes
defended in to the off side, calmly done
good slower one, he had already shaped up for the steer, but edged it just short of widish slip in the end, well bowled but Guptill gets away
smack! jeez, Guptill is murdering these full deliveries, got underneath this one, and swung it high and straight down the ground, it disappeared behind the sight screen
pushed out wide of point off the back foot
gives him the charge, he digs it short in to the batsman, but Brendon gets enough on it for the top edge to crash in to the fine leg boundary, not even luck is going Kenya's way
Baz pinches another single to bring Guptill on strike
now he goes wide down the leg side
tucks him up for room with one on the pads, but they are alert enough to sneak a leg bye
quicker from the bowler, played out off the back foot to midwicket
short, turning in, and helped away in a flash past midwicket for another boundary
now he goes way down the leg side
goes on the back foot and works a fuller one past a diving short midwicket
punched down the ground to mid off, who is ever so slow in getting to the ball, the single becomes a cakewalk
played out to short midwicket off the back foot
good delivery, tossed up, turning in, beats the forward push from the batsman, beats the keeper too
goes on the back foot to solidly defend this delivery turning in from outside off
punched away off the backfoot wide of mid off
full delivery endeavoring to target the stumps, but sprayed down the leg side in the end
tucked away firmly but a diving midwicket keeps them down to a single
dug in short, too short, going over the batsman, what's more, it;s a no-ball as well

whoops, Brendon tried to play that ramp shot over fine leg, got too far across and outside the stumps, and the full delivery crashed in to middle stump, and this happens off a no-ball, what a day for Kenya
pushed in to the gap at cover for a run
punched back to the bowler off the back foot
gets the bat down in front of pad and plays out a fullish ball to short midwicket
was nowhere near the pitch of the ball as he rushed down the track, but went through with the shot anyways, reaching out to get to the ball and lofting it over the bowler for a boundary
now he walks across the stumps, and whips this one through midwicket
pushed down to mid on off the front foot
hammered through midwicket. it was short and he threw his bat at it, there is a man at deep midwicket though
super stroke, waits for this delivery to arrive, and reverse sweeps it past backward point for another boundary

that'll do, another reverse swept boundary brings up a crushing victory for New Zealand, Brendon fetched it from leg stump, and didn;t bother to go down on a knee, just twirled his wrists to get the placement right
